isis.stitle: NEWAY AD-123/246 DRIVE AXLE AIR SUSPENSIONS - REPLACE - BUSHINGS - TRANSVERSE BEAM

note.para: Refer to and perform Steps 1 and 2 of bushings-equalizing beam, 4.2., prior to proceeding.

step1.para: Disconnect air springs at the lower end.
Remove transverse beam. If it does not come off easily, place a porta-power between the axle and transverse beam.
Support the beam. Press out old bushings ( Figure 10) with a hydraulic press.

caution.para: The beam support fixture must be securely mounted to the hydraulic press.

step1.para: Clean out bushing receptacles in beam of all foreign material before pressing new bushings into the beam.
Lubricate the new replacement bushing with an approved rubber lubricant or soap and water solution.

note.para: Do not use an oil-based lubrication or brake fluid as it can cause damage to the rubber.

step1.para: With the beam supported, press the bushing into the beam until it is centered. Inspect all parts for wear, cracks or failed welds. Repair or replace.
Reassemble new or rebushed equalizing beam to frame bracket.
Re-install, if necessary, wheels, camshafts and tires. Remove jack stands, and build air reservoir pressure in excess of 65 psi. Check RIDE HEIGHT CAPACITY CHART for proper air spring height.

caution.para: 100 psi is maximum allowable operating air system pressure.
